Title: Interhemispheric integration: I. Symmetry and convergence of the corticocortical connections of the left and the right principal sulcus (PS) and the left and the right supplementary motor area (SMA) in the rhesus monkey

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "...Pandya and Seltzer's area PG...and PGm (respectively, areas 7a and 7m of Cavada and Goldman-Rakic, 1989a)..."
p. 395: "...Pandya and Seltzer's area PG...and PGm (respectively, areas 7a and 7m of Cavada and Goldman-Rakic, 1989a)..."

"Area 46 can be divided into parts in its dorsal (46d) and ventral (46v) banks and their respective rims (46dr and 46vr), its fundus, and the cortex lateral to the sulcus (Preuss and Goldman-Rakic 1989; T.M. Preuss and P.S. Goldman-Rakic, unpublished observations [this very probably refers to PG91a])."

MBG91, p. 396:"...Pandya and Seltzer's (1982) areas...POa(i) and POa(e). POa(i) and POa(e) have been collectively termed 7ip by Cavada and Goldman-Rakic, 1989a." PS82, p. 197: "...area POa...in the lower bank of the intraparietal sulcus is described in detail elsewhere (Seltzer and Pandya 1980)." [SP80 subparcellates POa into POa-i and POa-e.]
@InterMapRelations.Comments: The areas POa-i and POa-e are falsely attributed to PS82. They were described by SP80 instead (see citation).

"For descriptive purposes, we subdivided the SMA into rostral and caudal parts (SMAr and SMAc)..."

"In neither case [cases 1+2: injections into the principal sulcus PS] did the injection zones extend beyond Walker's area 46."

@Injections.Citation:
p. 392: " Case 1: injections of WGA-HRP were made in the caudal parts of the dorsal and ventral banks of the left PS, while 3H-AAs were injected in the homotopic parts of the right."
p. 394: "There was some spread of tracer substance into the underlying white matter, but this was relatively minor, with the bulk of the injection spanning the six cortical laminae."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Case 1: Anterograde, contralateral WGA-HRP-labelling
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).

Case 1: Anterograde, ipsilateral WGA-HRP-labelling
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).
Case 1: Retrograde, contralateral WGA-HRP-labelling
Case 1: Retrograde, ipsilateral WGA-HRP-labelling

@Injections.Citation: p. 392: "Case 2: injections of 3H-AAs in the caudal part of the dorsal bank of the left PS and WGA-HRP in the homotopic part of the right."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Case 2: Anterograde, contralateral WGA-HRP-labelling.
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).

Case 2: Anterograde, ipsilateral WGA-HRP-labelling.
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).

@Injections.Citation:
p. 391: "In cases 3 and 4, injections were made in the cortex medial to the superior limb of the arcuate sulcus, at the junction of the dorsal and medial cortical surfaces... In case 3, injections of WGA-HRP were placed in the left hemisphere and injections of 3H-AA were made in the same area of the right (Fig. 1C)."
p. 393: "Case 3: injections of WGA-HRP in the rostral part of the left SMA and 3H-AA in the corresponding part of the right."
p. 398: "The injection zones in case 3 occupied the rostral part of the SMA, and there was a small amount of spread into the white matter on the right side (Fig. 1C)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments:
Case 3: Anterograde, contralateral WGA-HRP-labelling.
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).

Case 3: Anterograde, ipsilateral WGA-HRP-labelling.
The description of the laminar patterns is not clear with respect to lamina IV (pp. 399-400, 402).

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Neurons retrogradely labbeld with WGA-HRP from the SMA were distributed in a very similar pattern to the anterograde labelling, occupying the same constellation of ipsi- and contralateral areas, ususally within the confines of a column of terminals... Both the associational and callosal neurons were mainly concentrated in...layer III, with lesser numbers in layers II, V, and VI, and there was no obvious difference in the distribution between different associational and callosal areas."
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: Case 4: Retrograde, contralateral WGA-HRP-labelling.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Neurons retrogradely labbeld with WGA-HRP from the SMA were distributed in a very similar pattern to the anterograde labelling, occupying the same constellation of ipsi- and contralateral areas, ususally within the confines of a column of terminals... Both the associational and callosal neurons were mainly concentrated in...layer III, with lesser numbers in layers II, V, and VI, and there was no obvious difference in the distribution between different associational and callosal areas."
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: Case 4: Retrograde, ipsilateral WGA-HRP-labelling.
